titles.title: To require the Inspector General of the Small Business Administration to submit a quarterly report on fraud relating to certain COVID-19 loans.
To require the Inspector General of the Small Business Administration to submit a quarterly report on fraud relating to certain COVID-19 loans.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.
Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 26 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Reported by the Committee on Small Business. H. Rept. 118-182.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 146.

action.text: Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4666.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Williams (TX) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

committee.name: House Small Business
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

bill.summary: This bill requires the Small Business Administration's Office of Inspector General to report quarterly about fraud cases involving certain COVID-19 loans (e.g., Paycheck Protection Program loans).
